intro: Gaudinopsis macra subsp. micropyroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gaudinopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The species is notable for its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
